fullProgramDescription: The Division of Public Health in the School of Public Health offers an undergraduate major in Public Health. The undergraduate major in Public Health is designed to provide students with a broad understanding of the many facets of public health. Students in the program take courses that provide a foundation in the core disciplines of public health, including epidemiology, biostatistics, health policy, environmental health, and social and behavioral sciences. The major also includes a set of electives that allow students to explore specific areas of interest, such as global health, health equity, and health care systems.
shortProgramDescription: The Public Health B.A. at UC Berkeley provides a comprehensive understanding of public health principles and prepares students for careers or further study in the field.
classHighlights: The major begins with foundational courses: PB HLTH 101: Introduction to Public Health and Epidemiology (PB HLTH 142 or STAT C135 or COMPSCI C181), and Biostatistics (PB HLTH 142 or STAT C135).
Students also complete core courses in Environmental Health (PB HLTH 150), Health Policy (PB HLTH 157), and Social and Behavioral Sciences (PB HLTH 164 or PB HLTH 168).
Electives allow students to explore areas such as global health (e.g., PB HLTH 172, PB HLTH 180), health equity (e.g., PB HLTH 165, PB HLTH 166), and health systems (e.g., PB HLTH 157, PB HLTH 161).
learningOutcomes: Understand the core disciplines and principles of public health.
Apply epidemiological and biostatistical methods to public health problems.
Analyze the social, environmental, and policy determinants of health.
Develop skills in health promotion and disease prevention.
Evaluate public health programs and policies.
Communicate public health information to diverse audiences.
additionalInformation: The major is designed to be completed in four years. Students are advised to consult with the Division of Public Health advisers to plan their course of study.
